data.text:
Iran is a country located in Southern Asia on the continent of Asia. The population of Iran consists of 89,809,781 people, whereof 45,299,243 are male and 44,510,538 female. According to the current total feritily rate data for Iran , the female population of Iran currently produces on average 1.6721 children per woman during their life.

Top Level Domain

A top-level domain (TLD) is the highest level in the hierarchical domain name system (DNS) used to organize and categorize websites on the internet. It appears at the end of a website's URL, following the final dot, and serves as a crucial part of web addresses. Each country has their own top-level domain that is commonly used for regional websites. The top-level domain of Iran is .ir and is widley used for the country's most recognized websites.

Phone Code

A country's phone code, also known as the country calling code or international dialing code, is a numerical prefix used in telephone numbers to indicate the country from which a call is being made. These codes are essential for international communication, as they help route calls to the correct destination around the world. Each country has a unique country code assigned by the International Telecommunication Union (ITU), and these codes typically consist of one to four digits. For example, the United States is associated with the country code +1, while the United Kingdom has +44 and Germany has +49. When making international calls, individuals must dial the appropriate country code before entering the local phone number to ensure the call reaches its intended recipient in the correct country. Country phone codes are a vital part of global telecommunications, facilitating seamless connections across borders. The phone code of Iran us +98 and is placed before the domestic phone number when a call needs to be setup from outside of the contry border.
